fields.description:
In my page text I have this entry:

... a [Terms Of Reference|^WiKi TOR.doc] written by ...

And it appears as

... a WiKi TOR.doc written by ...

Rather than 

... a Terms Of Reference written by ...

as I would expect by reference to the guide.
fields.summary: Link in format [my link name|pagename^attachment.ext] shows attachment.ext

fields.description: It currently shows you the pages that link to the _page_ the attachment is on?!
fields.summary: Renaming attachments screen is incorrect

fields.description:
Index old versions of stuff: content and attachments.

By default, search should only apply to most recent versions, but option to search older versions.

If there are search 'hits' in multiple versions of a single document, there should probably be some UI trickery that lets you drill down, rather than overwhelming the results with a lot of the one thing.
fields.summary: Make old versions of stuff searchable
Add ability to search historical pages and attachments

fields.description: We need to make it run through the AbstractHtmlGeneratingMacro like the other macros do.
fields.summary: Search macro results are borked

fields.description: None of the Confluence macros seem to be able to access SSL protected pages (HTTPS protocol). We've setup just about all services to use https and hence can't get any macros which load resources over http to work. Enabling http for the Confluence server is one possible solution but not very elegant since that'd beat the whole purpose of securing sites using SSL.
fields.summary: HTTPS support for macros
Create page with template may have problems if parent page has non-ASCII title

fields.description:
The loading of the start page of both http://wiki.bejug.org and http://wiki.javapolis.com is really sloooooow.  

The Sparc hardware is powerfull enough to handle this. We have other private wiki's that we use which work on the same BEA WLS appserver and they're bleeding fast, so is the BeJUG Portal (http://www.bejug.org).

We're using the open-source confluence license for both wiki's, which we've really seperated (two separate WAR installs) instead of uses two spaces.  Maybe that's the problem ????

We'll be getting more traffic once the conference is getting closer (13th of December) so you're help would be very welcome !

Thanks in advance,
Stephan
fields.summary: Confluence Performance problem

fields.description: We want to remove any PI from the list where the last modifier != the owner, as that means the PI was either just added by the system, or by an admin user.
fields.summary: Dashboard recent updates lists irrelevant personal information entities

fields.description:
Hi

We are using Confluence heavily and we would like to get usage stats of confluence. Where do I find access logs for confluence so I can run some usage stats information from it ?

fields.description: LinkManager assumes that if the content it's renaming links in doesn't have a space key, it's an error.
fields.summary: Can not rename page when it has links from a user profile

fields.description:
Let's make an inline decorator used to display all blog posts. 
- we should also make the inline decorator editable, so users can control how their blog posts are displayed, like the page display decorator.
fields.summary: Make blog display use inline decorators

fields.description:
Let's add a link from the spaces list on the dashboard, and from the space pages list page.

Anywhere else?
fields.summary: Add more links to the recent blog posts page
BOB: Run functional tests against Weblogic

fields.description: We need to work out how to extract the excerpt, then presumably edit the blog posts macro so that it just shows excerpts instead of the full content?
fields.summary: Excerpt macro

fields.description: Create a macro that just displays blog titles, smaller than the blog posts macro.
fields.summary: Blog titles macro

fields.description:
There are a few settings in the setup wizard we could remove to simplify it:
- remove the pool size, make it default to 10
- remove the backup directory, make it default to automatic
- remove any default setting that is not necessary for quick setup.
fields.summary: Simplify the setup wizard

fields.description: Find a simple DHTML list that we can use to show the user all of their viewable spaces in the nav bar.
fields.summary: DHTML spaces control

fields.description: Users often request buttons at the top and bottom of the create/edit and preview pages, to make it easier to submit quickly. Good idea - let's do it :)
fields.summary: Buttons at top and bottom

fields.description: We need to test the PDF export again bad data, poor entities, HTML includes, the c.a.com test space etc. In other words, try our hardest to break it.
fields.summary: Test PDF export!

fields.description:
The comments associated with a 1.1 attachment should be indexed and searchable too. 

They should also turn up as the snippet when the attachment is returned as a search result.
fields.summary: Index attachment comment

fields.description: Add at least brief descriptions for all existing macros and libraries.
fields.summary: Add brief descriptions for all existing macros

fields.description: Write a document covering the creation and packaging of macro libraries in Confluence 1.1 - include a mini Hello World example and package it as a JAR for people to use.
fields.summary: Document 1.1 macro packaging and creation

fields.description: Need to upgrade FatCow to be shipped as a Confluence 1.1 macro library, so that people can download it and simply drop the JAR into their WEB-INF/lib directory and it will be picked up.
fields.summary: Upgrade FatCow to be shipped as a 1.1 macro library

fields.description: We need to look at the different attachment changes in Confluence 1.1, and write a document about using and managing attachments in Confluence - including versioning, comments, searching, WebDAV.
fields.summary: Document Attachment changes for 1.1

fields.description:
"This is a daily summary of all changes in Confluence of all spaces visible to you. 
If you do not want to receive this email any more you can change your profile options here."

the last word "here" is linked to the url:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/$baseurl/users/editmyprofile.action

$baseurl I assume should have been resolved to some other value along the way. Actually, as long as I'm already logged in, removing "$baseurl" altogether fixes the problem.
fields.summary: (Confluence Changes in the last 24 hours) has incorrect link to edit profile

fields.description: Example, When $baseurl is passed into the getText like so: $job.getText('daily.report.unsubscribe', ['here']) $baseurl appears in the resulting url link.
fields.summary: $baseurl showing up in notification emails
Edit page and edit blog post links should use page id rather than page title

fields.description:
There seem to be a few problems with ZIP files created from Confluence.

- the XP native unzip / archive browser doesn't like Confluence ZIP files (perhaps only ZIPs created on Unix?) - WinZip, Mac and *ix handle these files fine (See CONF-767 for more details)
- backup ZIPs created on Windows don't seem to import in Unix, and possibly the other way around.
fields.summary: Zip file creation problems

fields.description:
It would be very nice, if a blog post could be seperated into a "intro" and "body" texts. 
Doing so whould allow quick(er) overviews about new posts without being limited to subject (or reading the post).
This also supports discipline, in a way that posters are encouraged to actually describe what they are writing about.
fields.summary: Separate blog post into intro and body texts a la /.

We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!

fields.description:
This should retrieve a remote ical formatted file (via HTTP) and then display it in various formats (weekly, monthly etc) - I'm not sure how these states would be stored, but it would be very cool

Very useful with JRA-2971 and JRA-3465 as another method to get JIRA data into Confluence.

fields.description: When you follow a create link, it passes the name of the page that contained the link as a potential parent page. If the create link is inter-space, this shouldn't be passed as you can't have inter-space parenting.
fields.summary: Create links pass potential parents between spaces

fields.description:
When we make a create link, and the prospective page title contains high-bit characters, we need to encode the name of the page so that it doesn't get messed up by URL-encoding.

Suggest that for those pages we have an encodedName=BLAH parameter, where BLAH is the UTF-8 representation of the name, base64 encoded.
fields.summary: Need a safe way to make "Create" links for high-bit pages

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&pid=10530&statusIds=5&statusIds=6&updatedPrevious=604800000&sorter/field=updated&sorter/order=DESC&view=rss

The error is:

jiraissues: ParseException: Error on line 23: Expected "" to terminate element starting on line 9.
fields.summary: JIRA issue macro fails on certain URL
Have separate prefs for enabling sending and receiving of trackbacks

fields.description:
We've just been moving our network around (including some changes to domain names, etc) and as such some pages in confluence now point to referrers that no longer exist or that will soon be deprecated.

It would be nice if admins could clear referrers for a given page or clear all referers from a certain domain / IP addres, etc.
fields.summary: Ability to clear Referrers

fields.description:
We currently are using Scoop as "News" system. 
Scoop has a nice feature called a "who's online" box showing the currently active users. This in fact gives the editing crowd a feeling of "not being alone" and "we're a team". Therefore I'd love to see this in Confluence as well.
fields.summary: Include a "who's online" portlet

fields.description:
It would be a good idea to have "show recommended" and "show all" options on the database setup page that controlled the contents of the dialect pick-list. The list would default to the recommended set of databases we've actually tested the app against.

This would make it easier for users to tell which database choices are safe, and which are risky.

(With sufficient Javascripty goodness, you could associate tips/caveats with databases, so if the user selected the MySQL dialect the screen could display the autoReconnect=true tip, or recommend the jTDS JDBC driver for MS SQL Server, or if they selected an unsupported database, give them some advice as to what to do when it blows up. But that's possibly beyond the scope of this story)
fields.summary: Hide unsupported databases in setup pick-list.

fields.description:
Creating pages with chinese characters results in a page with garbled characters if Confluence is run under Tomcat or Resin. This is not a problem under orion. 

This is apparently caused by a bug in sitemesh, as the characters display correctly if the sitemesh filter is switched off.
fields.summary: Chinese characters garbled under Resin and Tomcat due to sitemesh bug

fields.description:
When deleting file attachments from a page, the pop-up confirmation box is great - unless you click the wrong "bin" icon and don't realise ;)

Would it be possible to display the attachment file name in that confiramtion dialog, eg:

"Are you sure you want to delete "abc.gif" from this page?"

That way you get a clear confirmation of what file will be deleted before you condem it to the ether.
fields.summary: State attachment file name on "delete attachment" dialog

fields.description:
These are consequently exported aswell. When a user attemtps to import this zip into another database (say postgres), the import fails when trying to import into the extrnlnks.url column. (which is only VARCHAR(255)).

Solution to implement: maybe bump up char limit to 500 and crop referral urls exceeding this limit *on creation*

Also need to update BackupImporter to include a check for url's that exceed this limit and crop them, so that import does not die for older backups.
fields.summary: Referral links exceeding 255 are added for HSQL users

fields.summary: Weblogic Support

fields.description:
Trying to use the attachment/link feature:
[my link name|^attachment.doc] 

The finished page shows up with just the link 'attachment.doc' as a hyperlink to the attachment.  Cannot get the feature to use the vanity name as a link to the attachment.  Even tried it with the full page name syntax - [my link name|page name^attachment.doc] and it still doesnt work.
fields.summary: Link names not showing up for attachments

fields.description: We are using JIRA for Confluence's user management. We have a Confluence license for 25 users and have a total of 52 users in our JIRA installation. We only have 21 users in the confluence-user group in JIRA (only confluence-administrators and confluence-users have USE permission in Confluence). If we try to grant use access to "anyone" so that anonymous users can look at our Confluence spaces, we get an error in the license information because it registers all 52 users from JIRA.
fields.summary: Granting "anyone" use permission breaks with JIRA user management

fields.description:
Often when I pass by a page, I am wondering what the last changes to the page have been.
I can do this going to previus version and selecting "to current" from the last but one change. As I do this, I am wondering whether this would make sense as a link on the page itself. Read a "latest changes".

I also imagine that people won' really agree on a definition of "latest". This can be "latest (absolut) changes"  or "changes since I edited the page", or "changes in the last 24h".
Mhhm, maybe this can be configured?
fields.summary: Single Click "Changes"

fields.description:
I've got serveral requests fro users for a "Recently Updated" list.
Can I change this somehow?
Or is there an easy way to create a page having a longer history?
fields.summary: Change number of entries in Dashboard:"Recently Updated"

fields.description:
Check the following:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/Formatting+testing

For example {{blah}}blah renders with the braces visible. This isn't such a big thing except for the JSPWiki export/import generating a huge amount of the notation without required white space around the markup which is required by the parser.
fields.summary: Most formatting code fails if ending touches a non-separator character

fields.description:
It would be nice if there was a standard way of specifying a caption for {code} macros.  The caption would ideally be displayed aligned top-left (outside) the code panel.

eg.

Example 4.2 - Solve any problem imaginable
+-------------------------------------------+
| blah blah blah fubar wibble;              |
| blah blah blah fubar wibble;              |
| blah blah blah fubar wibble;              |
| blah blah blah fubar wibble;              |
+-------------------------------------------+

The caption would have a specific style associated with it allowing css control of visual appearence.  From memory is there not some sort of "caption" feature on tables (use for accessibility purposes) that you might be able to use for this (as it can be visible or not, top or bottom, etc)?
fields.summary: Allow caption to be specified in {code} macro

fields.description:
When you delete a group, you have the option of moving the users in that group to another group.  This is great, I found out about it today when recreating a group with a new name.

The problem, however, is that when you delete a group and move the users to another group, the space permissions don't follow... you still have spaces with permissions set for the old, deleted group.

I think it would be nice if, when you delete a group and have the users in that group migrated to a new group, you have the option of changing all space permissions so that they are changed from the old group to the new group.  If you follow me.
fields.summary: Migrating groups doesn't affect space permissions
Create {bug} and {tip} macros for software documentation

fields.description:
It would be nice if you did not need to click "re-edit" when previewing a new page or edits to an existing page for two reasons:

- It would be faster to be able to just scroll down and then continue editing if the edit box were re-displayed automatically below the preview

- It is often useful to refer to the preview while editing without needing to keep switching between the two modes.
fields.summary: When previewing a page, display edit box below the preview
Resize "recent changes" list in dashboard and space summary page

fields.description:

Tried to add a new page with a "?" (question mark) character within the page title.

This character was accepted, but caused major problems on the following screen.  Couldn't view the page correctly.

Easy fix would be to filter question marks along with the other already screened characters. (:, @, /, \, &, !, |, #, $, *, ;, ~, [, ], (, ), {, }, <, >).
fields.summary: Confluence: The title you have entered contains invalid characters (...) (question mark)

fields.description:
The notation guide shows how to set alignment of attached images as follows:

!image.gif|align=right, vspace=4!

However, how do I set center alignment?  I tried using align=center and even tried putting <center>!myImage.gif!</center> but with no joy.

If there is a way to center images horizontally, could the syntax be added to the notation guide as it is a very common requirement in our software documentation.

If there is no process to do this yet, could one be added ;)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1212].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 20 December 2011|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi Everyone,

Thanks for your continued feedback on this issue. 

As you can see, this issue was created quite some time ago, in fact a VERY long time ago on the scale of Web Browser development.

For a while now Chrome, Safari & Firefox have all had built in spellchecking, so as seen in the comments, this issue has become about providing support for Internet Explorer users.

For those that have been following the development of [Internet Explorer 10|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Explorer_10], you'll know Microsoft has included spell checking as a feature in their recent Developer Previews. 

Once released, this will give Internet Explorer users native spell checking functionality, at which point there will no longer be any long term value in having this functionality in Confluence. As such, today we are closing this request. 

Regards,
John Masson
Confluence Product Manager
{panel}

A spell checker would be really nice.
fields.summary: Spell Checker

fields.description:
See thread: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=5480&tstart=0

Most recently:

 What about having it so that you can pass in a time period and a max count.
The time period would be something like 7d4h for 7 days 4 hours (otherwise
assumed to be "forever"), and a max count would be a number of blogs to
show. The idea is very similar, just adapted slightly - see the examples:

{blog-posts:max=5|time=7d} show up to 5 blog posts in the last week
{blog-posts:time=1m} show all the blog posts for the last month
{blog-posts:max=10} show the latest 10 blog posts - regardless of time frame

The original thought behind this was to see if the blog feature could be used for "motd" like applications, such as system status notices. These tend to be only applicable for a short time, hence some form of expiration would be nice.
fields.summary: Enhance blog-posts macro to expire old blog posts from view

fields.description:
It would be nice with the ability to have external links open in a new browser window by use of a global configuration setting.

Additionally, it would be nice to be able to enable this behavior through markup.
fields.summary: Support links opening in new browser window

fields.description: Add ability to import a space by restoring the zip file created from a space export.
fields.summary: Space import

fields.description:
I've found that when you are creating numbered lists using the # markup, if you have large lists that get broken up by other markup, that the list numbering resets back to 1. It would be great if:

a) You could use a particular syntax for starting a numbered list at a specific starting value. Example:

#6 This is a numbered item that will start with 6. 

b) You could mark a block of markup with start and stop blocks. Maybe {list}{list} would work. So, something like:

{list}
# Item 1
# Item 2

{quote}
Stuff
{quote}

# Item 3
blah blah blah

# Item 4
{list}

would render as:

1. Item 1
2.# Item 2

| Stuff

3. Item 3
blah blah blah

4. Item 4
fields.summary: Add ability to start a numbered list at a specific starting value

fields.description:
The [http://www.touchgraph.com/index.html] TouchGraph Wiki Browser can be handy at times. It uses a really simple format http://www.usemod.com/cgi-bin/mb.pl?LinkDatabase as input.
Maybe generate it from entities.xml using Xquery?
fields.summary: Provide LinkDatabase for use by TouchGraph Wiki Browser

fields.description:
Some of our users are reporting that they can not comment on pages.

All these users are in "confluence users" and all the spaces have granted "leave comments" to confluence-users.
Strange. By the way, we use LDAP, but I don't hinkt this should make a difference here.
Administrators can comment. So can "a few" users.

Is this a known issue?

fields.description:
If you do a search on http://wiki.opensymphony.com for "velocity" (without quotes), the page says:

  (Displaying 1 to 10 of 43) 

However only two entries are listed. When you click "Next" you do get 10 more entries and things appear correctly, but something is causing the search results page not to render correctly. I believe it might be due to the velocity code being shown in the search results.
fields.summary: Search results for velocity get truncated on wiki.opensymphony.com

fields.description:
For some reason, Confluence indexes all DB indexes multiple times. This has several adverse effects:

1) The DB operates slower since it has to update multiple indexes instead of just one
2) The DB size requirements are significantly higher than with just one index

Example of one MySQL create statement from Confluence:

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS `SPACES`;
CREATE TABLE `SPACES` (
  `SPACEID` bigint(20) NOT NULL default '0',
  `SPACENAME` varchar(255) default NULL,
  `SPACEKEY` varchar(255) NOT NULL default '',
  `SPACEDESCID` bigint(20) default NULL,
  `HOMEPAGE` bigint(20) default NULL,
  `CREATOR` varchar(255) default NULL,
  `CREATIONDATE` datetime default NULL,
  `LASTMODIFIER` varchar(255) default NULL,
  `LASTMODDATE` datetime default NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY  (`SPACEID`),
  UNIQUE KEY `SPACEKEY` (`SPACEKEY`),
  KEY `HOMEPAGE` (`HOMEPAGE`),
  KEY `SPACEDESCID` (`SPACEDESCID`),
  KEY `HOMEPAGE_2` (`HOMEPAGE`),
  KEY `SPACEDESCID_2` (`SPACEDESCID`),
  KEY `HOMEPAGE_3` (`HOMEPAGE`),
  KEY `SPACEDESCID_3` (`SPACEDESCID`),
  KEY `HOMEPAGE_4` (`HOMEPAGE`),
  KEY `SPACEDESCID_4` (`SPACEDESCID`),
  KEY `HOMEPAGE_5` (`HOMEPAGE`),
  KEY `SPACEDESCID_5` (`SPACEDESCID`),
  KEY `HOMEPAGE_6` (`HOMEPAGE`),
  KEY `SPACEDESCID_6` (`SPACEDESCID`)
) TYPE=MyISAM;

where the HOMEPAGE and SPACEDESCID columns are indexed seven times for no reason.

The fix is to remove the duplicates from the indexes.
fields.summary: Multiple indexes in same DB column

fields.description: "New or update pages since your last login" link didn't work as it said.  In fact, it list almost all the pages instead page since my last login.
fields.summary: New or updated pages since your last login == show everything
NPE when clicking on the previous versions link when viewing v.1 of a page

fields.description:
The permissions check fails when the page is being linked by 'id' rather than by space key and title (which became the default in 1.0.3)

This is fixed in the new 1.0.3 distribution, but people encountering this problem can patch their own Confluence installations by placing the attached AbstractPageAction.class into their Confluence installations at confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/actions/ and restarting the server.
fields.summary: Permissions check for commenting fails

fields.description:
When running Confluence with other JDK's than SUN's the license decoder barfs when it tried to load SUN's implementation of the KeyFactory.

The offending code is located in the "atlassian-confluence-extras-1.jar" file and the class is "com\atlassian\confluence\license\decoder\ConfluenceLicenseDecoder.class". You must change the following line:

"KeyFactory keyFactory = KeyFactory.getInstance("DSA","SUN");"

.. into ...

"KeyFactory keyFactory = KeyFactory.getInstance("DSA");"

to let Confluence run on other JDK's. e.g IBM's JDK implementation that does not include SUN KeyFactory implementation but includes  their own.
fields.summary: KeyFactory provider still hardcoded to "SUN"

fields.description:
After entering text (russian in my case) on quicj search bar or on the search page confluence founds no pages. Search phrase is broken - double-byte characters seem to be treated as single-byte characters.

By the way {search:} tag works just fine.

The same problem occurs in almost every part of confluence e.g. export, references, attachments and other. The only thing that works almost correctly is "create new page".
fields.summary: search is not working with non-ascii characters

fields.description:
I just finished an update to 1.0.3 from 1.0.1. This is really rather trivial, but it seems that some rendering of new lines intended by the use of \\ do not work correctly. I am quite sure they were in 1.0.1.

I have images that exist in a documentation site within bulleted lists and wish to have them separated by some white space brom the bullet above and below (but without ending the list before the image and starting a new one after).

Example:
* Follow these instructions and then click *Next*.\\ {color:red}*Tip:*{color} You can copy and past the required information.\\ \\ !Helpful Image.jpg! \\ \\
* Another bulleted item.

The image will be pressed up against the previous and following bullets.

Is there any better way around this?

Thanks for really great software. It is such a pleasure to work with.

Jeff
fields.summary: New line code (\\) around images not working in 1.0.3

fields.description:
SessionTimedoutException - on all methods when timedout , so we can automaticaly login

AuthenticationFailureException  - on login
UnauthorisedOperationException  - on all page mod ( delete, store )
PageVersiomMismatchException - on page store
fields.summary: Add App Specific Exceptions to Remote API

fields.description:
At the moment on a conf server with many spaces ( docs.codehaus.org ) the initial load requires a call per space to get the user permissions.

This way I can decorate the tree with locks if the user has not got read access.

If this came back with the SpaceSummary , I would get it all in 1 round trip.
fields.summary: Add user permissions to the SpaceSummary

fields.description:
If you have nested lists, and the list items end with a tab (because they've been pasted in from elsewhere), the list misrenders rather weirdly

Example here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/Lists+and+Whitespace
fields.summary: List items ending with a tab misrender
Warn when page is concurrently edited by multiple users

fields.description:
This is specially important for the cases we're getting the HTML content from outside world such as:
- {html} macro
- {html-include} macro
- {rss} macro
- {jiraissues} macro

Having any bad data in any of the above mentioned items can lead us to invalid HTML, and pretty enough to break the whole WIKI rendering and PDF generation.
fields.summary: Fix any possible wiki redering/exporting flaws caused by invalid HTML, by applying JTidy

fields.description:
I like to make my browser fonts large.  And when I do this the main text area where I can edit a confluence page is a bit too tall.  So I end up scrolling the browser window up and down every time I edit a page.

On other wikis I've had the option to set the size of the editing text area.  Can you add this as a per-user option?  

It appears that the text area fits the width the browser window, so I suppose this would just be a height setting.  Or perhaps the text area can be made to fit the height as well as the width.
fields.summary: text area dimensions in preferences

fields.description:
a) The XML-RPC server defaults to serving ISO-8859-1 instead of UTF-8.
b) The XmlWriter class will _blow up_ on any character > 0xFF, which seems rather, well, stupid.

Fix, and make a patched library jar available for users.
fields.summary: Apache XML-RPC library blows up on high-bit chars

fields.description:
The message should explain why you can't remove yourself from the admin group, and suggest that you get some other administrator to remove you.

See CONF-1083
fields.summary: Improve error message for trying to remove yourself from admin group

fields.description:
Some versions of IE6 will load the stylesheet on an initial load or refresh, but totally fail to load it if it's in the browser cache.

Fix: serve the stylesheet with a .css extension, that way IE will still know it's a CSS file, even when loading from the cache.
fields.summary: Some versions of IE6 can't see the stylesheet

fields.description:
We run into lots of niggling problems with high-bit characters when we link to them by their title rather than by their ID.

Ideally, _only_ things we want to address externally: "view page" and "view blog posts" (and maybe page information) pages should use the page title as part of the URL, everything else should go by the page ID. It's safer that way.
fields.summary: Only "view page" links should go by page title, rest by page ID

fields.description: Umbrella issue for Weblogic support. Any Weblogic issues should be linked to this.
fields.summary: Weblogic support

fields.description: Umbrella issue for tracking progress of Oracle support. Link all oracle issues to this bug.
fields.summary: Oracle Support
